results.title: In the mainstream
results.creator_credit: Carousel Films and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “60 Minutes”.
Examines the new law in the United States whereby handicapped children must wherever possible, be mainstreamed, that is, educated in the classroom along with other children. Looks at how the new law is working - successful in some cases but a failure in others

results.title: Art for tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
In an exploration of the reactions to and applications of science and technology in the field of art, we are shown into the studios of various artists, such as Victor Vasarely and Yaacov Agam in Paris. The bizarre machines of Tinguely display a jaundiced attitude towards the values cherished by our technological era.

results.title: New weapons against crime
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom, Burton Benjamin and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Demonstrates the application of modern technology to combat crime. Shows uses of computers, voice prints, olefactronics to identify odours, video tape to record crimes, electronic eavesdropping devices, and chemicals to restrain violence.

results.title: A Circle of love
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A group of college students get together in a “circle of love”, ie an “encounter group” to improve interpersonal relationships. Comprises highlights from several sessions in which six students, who have never met before, react to taped instructions from a behavioural research institute. Participants learn to express their real feelings about themselves and their fellow students, and learn to overcome anxieties and shyness in the presence of others. Reporter: Walter Cronkite
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions

results.title: Miracle of the mind
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Webster, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Describes the attempts made by humans to understand the nature of the mind, and surveys the contribution science has made to this understanding. Evaluates present knowledge of the brain and mental functions in terms of future civilisation. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicholas Webster, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News

Episode of Series “21st Century”.

Episode of Series “21st Century”.

results.title: Fighting fear with fear
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Burton Benjamin, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Neurotic behaviour is just a bad habit that can be unlearned. This is the basis of a contronversial psychotherapeutic technique developed by Drs Thomas Stampfi and Donald Lewis. In the film, a 23 year-old secretary is treated with a bombardment of the terrifying situation she fears most. According to Stampfi and Lewis, facing fear head-on breaks down the neurosis so she can relearn what may make her happiest.

results.title: Cities of the future
results.creator_credit: Gordon Hyatt, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses radical approaches to town planning, showing various concepts. The totally planned new city, Brasilia; incorporation of historic elements as in Philadelphia; pedestrian areas in Miami and Montreal; planned residential extensions; and suggested new construction methods. Exciting architectural ideas include: weather-proofed cities, mega-structures surrounded by green-belts, multi-level cities and floating cities. Features some animated scenes. Narrated by Walter Cronkite and animated by John Hubley.

results.title: Industries of the future
results.creator_credit: David Tapper, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Considers the course of industry, technology and invention during the coming century. Examines the kind of innovations that will shape the civilisation of the future. Studies the opportunities and changes that will arise from the development of an industrially and scientifically oriented society. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Autos, autos everywhere
results.creator_credit: Philip Burton, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
The redesign, computerization and possible elimination of automobiles in the next century is predicted in this film. Experimental models using new power sources, and the trend towards taking responsibility away from human drivers are examined. A partially automated driving system, as well as dual-mode cars which hook up to an electric rail roadway where computers take full control are demonstrated. Major considerations in the prototypes studied are safety, air pollution and traffic congestion. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Atomic medicine
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Burton Benjamin, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Among the peaceful uses of the atom is the application of atomic radiation in medical research, diagnosis and treatment. Radiation “tagging and tracing” is a valuable technique in ascertaining the sizes and shapes of various glands such as the thyroid. Treatment of cancers in localized regions of the body is one of the most effective deterrents of the disease. This film points out how continuing research hopes to improve on methods now in use.
